info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:44AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rock Island, central Whiteside, northwestern Henry, eastern Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 943 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hampton, or near Bettendorf, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Bettendorf, East Moline, Morrison, Silvis, Le Claire, Prophetstown, Hampton, Port Byron, Erie, Garden Plain, Rapids City, Albany, Princeton, Tampico, Cordova, Lyndon, Riverdale and Cleveland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 299 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
